page.title: 16WOMENS JOBS IN GOREFIELD
page.content: 8 Gorefield women were interviewed in an Employment survey.Of the 3 who had {full-time}occupations,one mother travelled to Peterborough every day, one worked at King's Lynn and the other lady went 8 miles to West Walton.2 women worked{part-time;}both of them worked mornings only and both worked locally.One lady went only 0.25 miles by bicycle,whilst the other one travelled 3 miles by car.Two other ladies said that they did{casual}work. Both of them were involved in agriculture.One worker helped locally, she only worked 6 weeks a year;the other woman also helped on the land, but she worked for about half of the year mainly with flowers and fruit.
